Title: C# Sample: Create a WPF softphone for SIP calling through the Internet
Description: This project presents how to create a WPF softphone in C# that is able to register to a PBX and to initiate voice/audio calls through the Internet - using VoIP.
HomeWiki:
This sample application lets users use the VoIP technology to make SIP telephone calls through the Internet. In this article, it will be presented how to create a WPF softphone in C# that is able to register to a PBX and to initiate voice/audio calls.

Contents of the Documentation tab:

  • Prologue: The background of the softpone development (VoIP, SIP, PBX, WPF, etc.)
  • Insight: Take a quick look at the outcome of the programming solution presented below
  • Implementation: Code explanation for the WPF softphone (Phone.Window.xaml.cs)
  • Epilogue: Closing thoughts
  • List of References: Reviewed literature and instruments used
  • Appendix A: Phone.Window.xaml file
  • Appendix B: AboutWindow.xaml.cs file

Please, stop here for awhile and make sure that the tools below are available to you:

  • Microsoft Visual Studio
  • Microsoft .NET Framework 4.0
  • C# VoIP components
  • PBX, e.g. Asterisk
  • Other (desktop or software) VoIP phone for testing (e.g. X-Lite)


SIP call is established by using this C# sample softphone and Bria
